item.title: CFF - C Fast Fetch - Developed with l0py2
item.description: What is CFF? CFF consists in a system fetch written for GNU/Linux system. It uses the Kernel api to fetch info such as the uptime and the kernel release name. Why CFF? CFF is essencially a project developed for fun. However, it is the fastest fetching program due to being written in C. Compared to pfetch or even neofetch we get much lower execution times. Usually around 2 milliseconds.

item.title: Qtile
item.description: Qtile running on my machine: Using exa to list the files and cff to fetch sys info. Config file tree: . ├── autostart.sh ├── bar1.py ├── cbonsai.png ├── config.py ├── consts.py ├── gruvbox.py ├── keys.py ├── README.md └── workspaces.py Colorscheme and constant variables: As you can see from this site I love gruvbox. So I use a gruvbox palette defined in gruvbox.py. I then included this file in the other configuration files where I needed access to the colorscheme.
